categories.description: Princess Zelda is the titular character of The Legend of Zelda series and wielder of the Triforce of Wisdom.
Zelda is a playable fighter in Super Smash Bros., using magical attacks and transforming into Sheik in earlier games.
Jigglypuff is a Normal/Fairy-type Pokémon known for putting people to sleep with its singing.
Jigglypuff is one of the original 12 Super Smash Bros. characters, famous for its powerful Rest move.
Charizard is a Fire/Flying-type Pokémon and one of the most iconic starter evolutions from Generation I.
Charizard is a playable fighter in Super Smash Bros., either as part of Pokémon Trainer or as a standalone character.
Snorlax is a Normal-type Pokémon known for sleeping and blocking paths until woken with a Poké Flute.
Snorlax appears as a Poké Ball summon in Super Smash Bros., body-slamming opponents from above.
Celebi is a Psychic/Grass-type mythical Pokémon that can travel through time.
Sounds like Celeborn or Celebrimbor, but this time-traveling sprite is a Pokémon, not a Tolkien elf.
Geodude is a Rock/Ground-type Pokémon that looks like a boulder with muscular arms.
Eevee is a Normal-type Pokémon famous for its many possible evolutions (Vaporeon, Jolteon, Flareon, and more).
Eevee appears as a Poké Ball summon in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, tackling opponents with Take Down.
Pikachu is the iconic Electric-type Pokémon and franchise mascot since 1996.
Pikachu is one of the original 12 Super Smash Bros. characters and has appeared in every game.
Mewtwo is a Psychic-type legendary Pokémon created from Mew's DNA through genetic manipulation.
Mewtwo is a powerful fighter in Super Smash Bros. Melee, 4, and Ultimate with psychic-based attacks.
Ditto is a Normal-type Pokémon that can transform into anything using its Transform ability.
Partial credit for the existence of multiple clipboard apps called Ditto.
Porygon is the first artificial Pokémon, made entirely of programming code.
While it's a 'digital' creature in-universe, that doesn't make it actual tech terminology. Unless you confused it with 'Polygon'
Chansey is a Normal-type Pokémon that carries a healing egg in its pouch and has extremely high HP.
Blissey is Chansey's evolution, known for its nurturing nature and having the highest HP stat of any Pokémon.
Drowzee is a Psychic-type Pokémon that feeds on dreams through its tapir-like nose.
Hypno is Drowzee's evolution, carrying a pendulum it uses to hypnotize prey.
Electrode is an Electric-type Pokémon that resembles an upside-down Poké Ball and is known for exploding.
Magneton is an Electric/Steel-type Pokémon composed of three Magnemite linked together by magnetism.
Rotom is an Electric/Ghost-type Pokémon that can possess electrical appliances and change its form.
Arceus is the mythical 'God Pokémon' said to have created the entire Pokémon universe.
Despite its divine nature in Pokémon lore, Arceus is not from Greek mythology. It's a fictional Pokémon deity.
Dialga is a Steel/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that controls time itself.
Palkia is a Water/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that controls space and dimensions.
Giratina is a Ghost/Dragon-type legendary Pokémon that rules the Distortion World and controls antimatter.
Luxray is an Electric-type Pokémon with X-ray vision eyes that can see through anything.
Lucario is a Fighting/Steel-type Pokémon that can manipulate aura energy.
Lucario is a fighter in Super Smash Bros. Brawl, 4, and Ultimate, getting stronger as it takes more damage.
Mew is the mythical Psychic-type ancestor of all Pokémon, said to contain the DNA of every species.
Mew appears in all six Super Smash Bros. games as a rare Poké Ball summon.
Greninja is a Water/Dark-type ninja frog Pokémon and the final evolution of Froakie.
Greninja is a playable fighter in Super Smash Bros. 4 and Ultimate with fast, ninja-style attacks.
Audino is a Normal-type Pokémon that can sense feelings through its ear feelers and is known for giving high EXP.
Latios is a Dragon/Psychic-type legendary Pokémon known for high intelligence and flight speed.
Latias is a Dragon/Psychic-type legendary Pokémon and Latios's counterpart, known for sensitivity and camouflage.
Slowpoke is a Water/Psychic-type Pokémon known for its slow reactions and dopey expression.
Abra is a Psychic-type Pokémon that sleeps 18 hours a day and teleports away when threatened.
Kadabra is Abra's evolution, a Psychic-type that emits alpha waves and bends spoons with its mind.
Alakazam is Kadabra's evolution with an IQ of 5,000 and incredibly powerful psychic abilities.
Nidoran is a Poison-type Pokémon that was the first to have distinct male and female forms.
Gengar is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon that hides in shadows to steal heat from surroundings.
Gengar appears as a Poké Ball summon in Super Smash Bros., putting opponents to sleep with its gaze.
Arcanine is a Fire-type Pokémon known for its legendary speed, loyalty, and majestic appearance.
Gastly is a Ghost/Poison-type Pokémon composed almost entirely of poisonous gas.
Koffing is a Poison-type Pokémon that stores toxic gases in its spherical body.
Weezing is Koffing's evolution, consisting of two Koffing fused together into one toxic entity.
Tangela is a Grass-type Pokémon whose body is completely covered in thick blue vines.
Nidoking is the final evolution of male Nidoran, a powerful Poison/Ground-type with devastating strength.
Starmie is a Water/Psychic-type starfish Pokémon with a glowing jewel core that transmits radio waves.
Dratini is a Dragon-type Pokémon that was long considered a mythical creature before being discovered.
Dragonite is Dratini's final evolution, a Dragon/Flying-type known for rescuing people at sea.
Skorupi is a Poison/Bug-type Pokémon that looks like a scorpion with powerful pincers.
Klefki is a Steel/Fairy-type Pokémon that collects keys on its ring-shaped body.
Xerneas is the Fairy-type legendary Pokémon representing life in Pokémon X.
Pixilate is a Pokémon ability that turns Normal-type moves into Fairy-type moves and boosts their power.
Axew is a Dragon-type Pokémon with tusks that it uses to crush berries and mark territory.
DIO is the iconic main villain of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure with time-stopping powers.
Dio is the heavy metal band led by Ronnie James Dio.
Metallica is Risotto Nero's iron-manipulating Stand in JoJo Part 5.
Metallica is the legendary thrash metal band formed in 1981, one of the 'Big Four' of thrash metal.
Aerosmith is Narancia's miniature fighter plane Stand in JoJo Part 5.
Aerosmith is the American rock band formed in Boston, known for hits like 'Dream On' and 'Walk This Way'.
Red Hot Chili Pepper is Akira Otoishi's electricity-based Stand in JoJo Part 4.
Red Hot Chili Peppers is the funk rock band from Los Angeles, known for blending punk and funk.
Purple Haze is Fugo's deadly virus-spreading Stand in JoJo Part 5.
Purple Haze is the iconic Jimi Hendrix song from 1967.
King Crimson is Diavolo's time-erasing Stand in JoJo Part 5 that can skip through time.
King Crimson is the British progressive rock band known for pioneering prog rock in the late 1960s.
Gold Experience is Giorno's life-giving Stand in JoJo Part 5 that can create life.
Gold Experience is the double album by Prince from 1995.
Moody Blues is Abbacchio's replay Stand in JoJo Part 5 that can re-enact past events.
The Moody Blues is the British rock band known for progressive rock and hits like 'Nights in White Satin'.
Whitesnake is Pucci's disc-extracting Stand in JoJo Part 6 that can steal memories and abilities.
Whitesnake is David Coverdale's rock band formed after he left Deep Purple.
Weather Report is a weather-controlling Stand user in JoJo Part 6 with powerful meteorological abilities.
Weather Report is the jazz fusion band co-founded by Joe Zawinul and Wayne Shorter.
Foo Fighters (F.F.) is a plankton colony Stand user in JoJo Part 6 who becomes an ally.
Foo Fighters is Dave Grohl's rock band formed in 1994 after Nirvana ended.
Oasis is Secco's ground-softening Stand in JoJo Part 5 that can swim through solid matter.
Oasis is the British rock band formed by the Gallagher brothers in 1991.
Soft Machine is Zucchero's deflating Stand in JoJo Part 5 that can deflate targets like balloons.
Soft Machine is the British progressive rock band that pioneered the Canterbury scene.
White Album is Ghiaccio's ice-armor Stand in JoJo Part 5 that freezes everything around it.
The White Album is The Beatles' iconic self-titled 1968 double album.
Tusk is Johnny Joestar's spin-powered Stand in JoJo Part 7 that evolves through multiple acts.
Tusk is the 1979 double album by Fleetwood Mac.
Scary Monsters is Diego Brando's dinosaur-transforming Stand in JoJo Part 7.
Scary Monsters (and Super Creeps) is the 1980 David Bowie album.
Highway to Hell is Thunder McQueen's suicide-pact Stand in JoJo Part 6.
Highway to Hell is the 1979 AC/DC album, the last with lead singer Bon Scott.
Bohemian Rhapsody is Ungalo's fiction-manifesting Stand in JoJo Part 6 that brings stories to life.
Bohemian Rhapsody is Queen's legendary 1975 song from the album A Night at the Opera.
Stone Free is Jolyne Cujoh's string-based Stand in JoJo Part 6 that can unravel her body into strings.
Stone Free is the Jimi Hendrix song from the 1967 album Are You Experienced.
Robert E.O. Speedwagon is a beloved ally in JoJo Parts 1-2 and founder of the Speedwagon Foundation.
REO Speedwagon is the American rock band known for hits like 'Keep On Loving You'.
Crazy Diamond is Josuke's restoration Stand in JoJo Part 4 that can repair anything except its own user.
Crazy Diamond is referenced in Pink Floyd's 'Shine On You Crazy Diamond', a tribute to Syd Barrett.
Killer Queen is Kira's explosive Stand in JoJo Part 4 that can turn anything into a bomb.
Killer Queen is the 1974 Queen song from the album Sheer Heart Attack.
The Hand is Okuyasu's space-erasing Stand in JoJo Part 4 that can scrape away anything from existence.
Named after 'The Band' - but 'The Hand' itself is not a band name.
Cell is the bio-android villain in Dragon Ball Z, created from the cells of the strongest warriors.
Spreadsheet cells are a bit far fetched, but we won't count this one wrong.
Androids 16, 17, 18, and others are cyborg warriors in Dragon Ball Z created by Dr. Gero.
Android is Google's mobile operating system, powering billions of devices worldwide.
Fusion is the technique in Dragon Ball Z where two warriors merge into one powerful being.
Fusion is AMD's processor line combining CPU and GPU on one chip.
The Ford Fusion is a mid-size sedan produced from 2006 to 2020.
Vegeta is the Saiyan prince in Dragon Ball Z, his name derived from 'vegetable'.
Kakarot is Goku's Saiyan birth name in Dragon Ball Z, a pun on 'carrot'.
Frieza is the tyrannical emperor in Dragon Ball Z, his name a pun on 'freezer'.
Frieza is from Dragon Ball Z, not Pokémon. Despite the cold-themed name similar to Articuno's Japanese name (Freezer), he's not a Pokémon.
Piccolo is the Namekian warrior in Dragon Ball Z, named after the small flute instrument.
Trunks is Vegeta's son in Dragon Ball Z, named after underwear like the rest of the Briefs family.
Krillin is Goku's best friend in Dragon Ball Z, his name derived from 'kuri' (chestnut in Japanese).
Sounds like it could be a Pokémon, but Krillin is Goku's bald best friend, not a pocket monster.
Gohan is Goku's eldest son in Dragon Ball Z. 'Gohan' means 'cooked rice' or 'meal' in Japanese.
Despite the similar sound, Gohan is Goku's half-Saiyan son, not a kingdom of horse-lords. Rohan is the realm in Middle-earth; Gohan is busy going Super Saiyan.
Not a rock-eating Goron from Death Mountain - Gohan is a half-Saiyan warrior who just wants to study.
Raditz is Goku's evil brother in Dragon Ball Z, his name derived from 'radish'.
Nappa is Vegeta's bald henchman in Dragon Ball Z, named after a Japanese term for leafy greens.
Broly is the Legendary Super Saiyan in Dragon Ball Z movies, his name derived from 'broccoli'.
Shenron is the wish-granting eternal dragon in Dragon Ball Z who grants wishes when summoned with the Dragon Balls.
Shenron is from Dragon Ball Z, not Pokémon. While Pokémon has dragons like Dragonite, Shenron is not one of them.
Majin is a title/race in Dragon Ball Z meaning 'demon person', most famously Majin Buu and Majin Vegeta.
Hit is the legendary assassin from Universe 6 in Dragon Ball Super, known for his Time-Skip technique.
Link is the hero of The Legend of Zelda series, wielder of the Master Sword and Triforce of Courage.
A link is a hyperlink or reference in HTML/web that connects one resource to another.
Link is one of the original 12 Super Smash Bros. characters and has appeared in every game.
Ganondorf is the main antagonist of The Legend of Zelda series, wielding the Triforce of Power.
Ganondorf is a heavy fighter in Super Smash Bros. Melee onwards, known for powerful attacks.
Sheik is Princess Zelda's ninja alter ego in Ocarina of Time.
Sheik is a playable fighter in every Super Smash Bros. since Melee, known for speed and agility.
Toon Link is the cel-shaded hero from The Wind Waker and related games.
Toon Link is a playable fighter in Super Smash Bros. Brawl, 4, and Ultimate.
Navi is Link's fairy companion in Ocarina of Time, known for saying 'Hey! Listen!'
Navi is an early AMD GPU architecture from the RDNA family.
Hyrule is the kingdom where most Legend of Zelda games take place, home to the Triforce.
The Triforce is the sacred golden relic in Zelda representing Power, Wisdom, and Courage.
The Sheikah are a mysterious ninja-like tribe in Zelda who created ancient technology like the Sheikah Slate.
Gorons are a rock-eating race in The Legend of Zelda who live on Death Mountain.
Not to be confused with Rohan, the horse-kingdom of Middle-earth. Gorons are rock-eating mountain dwellers from Hyrule who roll around and call everyone 'brother.'
Sounds like Gohan but these boulder-bodied bros eat rocks in Hyrule, not ki blasts on Namek.
Zora are an aquatic race in The Legend of Zelda, including characters like Princess Ruto and Prince Sidon.
Rito are a bird-like race in The Legend of Zelda known for their archery skills and flight.
Koroks are forest spirits in The Legend of Zelda who evolved from the Kokiri.
Bokoblins are pig-like enemies in The Legend of Zelda series, common foes in Breath of the Wild.
Lynels are powerful centaur-lion enemies in The Legend of Zelda, among the toughest foes in Breath of the Wild.
Moblins are bulldog-faced enemies in The Legend of Zelda, larger and stronger than Bokoblins.
The Ocarina of Time is a magical instrument in The Legend of Zelda that can control time and teleport Link.
The Master Sword is the legendary Blade of Evil's Bane in The Legend of Zelda, wielded by Link to defeat Ganon.
Din is the Goddess of Power in The Legend of Zelda, who created the red earth.
Not the Mandalorian Din Djarin - this Din is a Hylian goddess of power, not a bounty hunter in beskar armor.
Farore is the Goddess of Courage in The Legend of Zelda who created all life.
Nayru is the Goddess of Wisdom in The Legend of Zelda who created the laws of the world.
Revali is the arrogant Rito Champion in Breath of the Wild with mastery over wind.
Urbosa is the Gerudo Champion in Breath of the Wild known for her lightning powers.
Daruk is the Goron Champion in Breath of the Wild with a protective barrier ability called Daruk's Protection.
Mipha is the Zora Champion in Breath of the Wild with healing powers and a deep affection for Link.
Exodia the Forbidden One instantly wins the duel if all five pieces are in hand.
Blue-Eyes White Dragon is Seto Kaiba's signature monster and one of the most iconic Yu-Gi-Oh! cards with 3000 ATK.
Dark Magician is Yugi Muto's signature monster, one of the most iconic spellcaster cards in Yu-Gi-Oh!
Kuriboh is a cute furball monster that can prevent battle damage in Yu-Gi-Oh!
Obelisk the Tormentor is one of the three Egyptian God Cards in Yu-Gi-Oh!
An obelisk is a tall stone monument, not a celestial body. The Yu-Gi-Oh! card is named after the monument type.
Slifer the Sky Dragon is one of the three Egyptian God Cards, named after a Yu-Gi-Oh! producer.
The Winged Dragon of Ra is one of the three Egyptian God Cards, named after the Egyptian sun god.
Ra is an Egyptian god, not Greek. The Greek sun god equivalent would be Helios or Apollo.
Red-Eyes Black Dragon is Joey Wheeler's signature monster and rival to Blue-Eyes White Dragon.
Red-Eyes Black Dragon is from Yu-Gi-Oh!, not Magic: The Gathering. MTG has dragons but not this one.
Elemental Heroes are Jaden Yuki's archetype of fusion-based superhero monsters in Yu-Gi-Oh! GX.
Cyber Dragon is a machine-type monster central to the Cyber archetype in Yu-Gi-Oh!
Cyber Dragon is from Yu-Gi-Oh!, not Magic: The Gathering. MTG has artifact creatures but not this one.
Stardust Dragon is Yusei Fudo's ace Synchro Monster in Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's.
Stardust Crusaders is JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 3, featuring Jotaro's journey to defeat DIO.
Ziggy Stardust is David Bowie's iconic alter ego from the 1972 album The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust.
Stardust is cosmic dust composed of particles in space.
Number 39: Utopia is Yuma Tsukumo's ace Xyz Monster in Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal.
Pot of Greed draws two cards - so powerful it's been banned for years in competitive play.
Mirror Force destroys all attacking monsters when activated, one of the most iconic trap cards.
Mystical Space Typhoon (MST) destroys spell/trap cards and is a staple card in many decks.
Monster Reborn is one of the most powerful spell cards, reviving any monster from either graveyard.
Greymon is Agumon's Champion form, a dinosaur Digimon breathing fire.
Greymon is a Digimon, not a Pokémon. Despite being a dinosaur monster, it's from the Digital World.
Agumon is the partner Digimon of Tai Kamiya in Digimon Adventure, a small dinosaur-like creature.
Despite being a reptilian creature from a 'mon' franchise, Agumon is a Digimon, not a Pokémon.
Gabumon is Matt Ishida's partner Digimon, a reptile wearing a wolf pelt.
Despite being a creature from a 'mon' franchise, Gabumon is a Digimon, not a Pokémon.
Patamon is T.K. Takaishi's partner Digimon, a winged hamster-like creature that digivolves into Angemon.
Gatomon is Kari Kamiya's cat-like Champion-level Digimon who can digivolve to Angewomon.
Angemon is Patamon's angelic Champion form in Digimon Adventure, known for defeating Devimon.
Despite being an angelic being, Angemon is a Digimon character, not a figure from Greek mythology.
Angewomon is Gatomon's Ultimate form in Digimon Adventure, an angelic archer Digimon.
Devimon is a fallen angel Digimon and the first major villain in Digimon Adventure.
Beelzemon is Impmon's Mega form in Digimon Tamers, a demon lord Digimon inspired by Beelzebub.
Though named after Beelzebub from Abrahamic traditions, Beelzemon is a Digimon, not a Greek mythological figure.
Omnimon is the DNA Digivolution fusion of WarGreymon and MetalGarurumon.
WarGreymon is Agumon's Mega form, wielding the Dramon Destroyers on its arms.
MetalGarurumon is Gabumon's Mega form, a cybernetic wolf with ice powers and missiles.
Leomon is a noble lion warrior Digimon known for dying heroically in every series.
Myotismon is a vampire Digimon and major villain in Digimon Adventure.
Piedmon is a clown-like Dark Master Digimon who turns enemies into keychains with his Trump Sword.
Machinedramon is a Dark Master in Digimon Adventure, one of the most powerful machine-type Digimon.
MetalSeadramon is a Dark Master, a giant sea serpent covered in the rare metal Chrome Digizoid.
Puppetmon is a Dark Master made of wood who controls others like puppets with his Puppet Pummel attack.
Imperialdramon is the DNA Digivolution of ExVeemon and Stingmon in Digimon Adventure 02.
Alphamon is a Royal Knight Digimon who leads the Royal Knights and represents emptiness.
Majin Buu is the ancient pink magical being in Dragon Ball Z who absorbs enemies and can turn people into candy.
Beerus is the God of Destruction in Dragon Ball Super, a cat-like deity who can erase anything from existence.
Whis is Beerus's angelic attendant in Dragon Ball Super, able to rewind time and trains Goku and Vegeta.
Zeno is the Omni-King in Dragon Ball Super, the supreme ruler of all universes who can erase entire realities.
Zeno of Citium founded Stoicism; Zeno of Elea created famous paradoxes like Achilles and the Tortoise.
Jinzo is an android monster famous for negating all trap cards while on the field.
Sangan is a three-eyed fiend that searches for weak monsters when it's destroyed or sent to the graveyard.
Marshmallon is an indestructible fairy monster that looks like a cute blob and damages attackers.
Summoned Skull is a classic fiend-type monster and one of the original powerful beatsticks in Yu-Gi-Oh! with 2500 ATK.
